SpeechRecognitionPhrase.summary: NOTE Experimental The SpeechRecognitionPhrase interface of the Web Speech API represents a phrase that can be passed to the speech recognition engine for contextual biasing.

SpeechRecognitionPhraseBoost.summary:
NOTE Experimental The boost read-only property of the
interface returns a floating point number representing the weight you want to give the corresponding .
SpeechRecognitionPhraseBoost.value: A floating point number between 0.0 and 10.0 (inclusive) that represents the weight you want to apply to the phrase. This value is roughly equivalent to the natural log of the number of times more likely the website thinks this phrase to appear than what the speech recognition model knows. Higher values make the phrase more likely to be recognized.A high value such as 9.0 or 10.0 might make the recognition engine erroneously recognize other phrases as the specified phrase. Therefore, such values should be used rarely when constructing SpeechRecognitionPhrase objects.

SpeechRecognitionPhrasePhrase.summary: NOTE Experimental The phrase read-only property of the interface returns a string containing the word or phrase you want boosted in the recognition engine's contextual bias.

SpeechRecognitionPhraseSpeechRecognition.summary: NOTE Experimental The SpeechRecognitionPhrase() constructor creates a new object.

remarks.para: An array of SpeechRecognitionPhrase objects is passed into the speech recognition engine via the property for contextual biasing.
